title: General Paper 1 FQE (June 2016)
description: Final Qualifying Examination General Paper One from June 2016. Contains 31 questions covering Anatomy, Surgery, Pharmacology, and Nursing Professionalism.

questions.question: The second step in clotting mechanism is:
questions.explanation: Sequence: 1. Vascular Spasm, 2. Platelet Plug, 3. Coagulation.

questions.question: Indicate which of the following statements are TRUE:

options.text: Arthrology is the study of joints
Kinesiology is the study of body movement
Arthrology is the study of bones
Kinesiology is the study of kidneys

questions.explanation: Arthrology = Joints. Kinesiology = Movement.

questions.question: The risk factors for cataract formation include:

options.text: Age, Trauma, Metabolic Disturbances, Systemic Diseases
Diabetes Mellitus, Systemic Diseases, Eye Strain

questions.explanation: Ageing, Trauma, Diabetes (Metabolic), and Steroids are key factors. Eye strain is not a cause.

questions.question: Multiple sclerosis is a progressive disease of the nervous system due to:

options.text: An autoimmune disorder of the myelin sheath in central nervous system
An autoimmune disorder affecting the myo-neural junction
Is an autoimmune attack of the peripheral nerve myelin
Degeneration of the nerves in the peripheral nerves system

questions.explanation: MS is demyelination of the CNS.

questions.question: The holding instruments used in a general set include:
questions.explanation: Alice (Allis), Littlewood, and Artery forceps are holding/grasping instruments.

questions.question: The purpose for abdominal Paracentesis is:

options.text: Diagnostic examination of kidney, relieve of pressure
Diagnostic examination of ascitic fluid, relieve of pressure
Diagnostic examination of gall bladder, relieve of pressure
Diagnostic examination of liver, relieve of pressure

questions.explanation: Paracentesis drains ascitic fluid from the peritoneal cavity.

questions.question: Acne vulgaris is associated with:

options.text: Fungi infection that arises within the hair follicles

questions.explanation: Acne is inflammation/occlusion of the pilosebaceous unit.

questions.question: Organs that can be palpated on the left hypochondriac region include:
questions.explanation: Spleen, Stomach, and Left Kidney are in the Left Hypochondrium.

questions.question: Effective traction is achieved by:

options.text: Avoiding the line of the pull on the traction
Resting weights on the bed or floor
Resultant line of pull being in the opposite direction
Allowing weights to hang freely at all times

questions.explanation: Weights must hang freely to provide constant force.

questions.question: Common sites of endometriosis include:

options.text: Rectal vaginal septum, ovary, Broad ligament
Rectal vaginal septum, utero sacro ligament, ureters

questions.explanation: Ovaries, Pouch of Douglas/Septum, and Ligaments are most common.

questions.question: Haemophilia A results from deficiency of factor:
questions.explanation: Hemophilia A = Factor VIII. Hemophilia B = Factor IX.

questions.question: The nursing diagnosis for a patient with psoriasis who quit her job due to appearance concerns is:

options.text: Ineffective coping related to loss of skin integrity
Social isolation related to loss of skin integrity
Impaired skin integrity related to presence of lesions
Anxiety related to lack of knowledge

questions.explanation: Quitting a job is an active maladaptive coping mechanism.

questions.question: Non absorbable sutures include:
questions.explanation: Silk and Nylon are non-absorbable. Vicryl and Catgut absorb.

questions.question: Accumulation of thick, purulent fluid within the pleural space is:
questions.explanation: Empyema is pus in the pleural cavity.

questions.question: The Nursing Council of Kenya (NCK) is established under The Nurses Act Cap:
questions.explanation: NCK is established by Cap 257.

questions.question: The etiology of 'impaired skin integrity related to surgical incision' is:
questions.explanation: Surgery is a treatment modality.

questions.question: The restricted zone in theatre refers to area:

options.text: In the operating room where scrub attire and surgical masks are required
In the operating room that interfaces with other theatre
Where only the surgical team can access
Where patients who have undergone special surgery are confined

questions.explanation: The restricted zone requires full surgical attire (masks/caps).

questions.question: An allergic reaction is:

options.text: A Clinical response to an immediate immunologic reaction
An abnormal heightened reaction to a stimulus
Inappropriate and often harmful response of the immune system to normally harmless substances

questions.explanation: Allergy is an inappropriate immune response to a harmless antigen.

questions.question: Complications of tension pneumothorax include:

options.text: Shifting of the heart and other mediastinal structures to the opposite side

questions.explanation: Mediastinal shift is the hallmark danger of tension pneumothorax.

questions.question: During resuscitation, appropriate chest compression in adults are (Ratio):
questions.explanation: Standard adult CPR ratio is 30:2.

questions.question: Write short notes on Varicella virus: Transmission and Condition.

options.text: Transmission: Direct contact with fluid from blisters

questions.question: State three (3) possible causes of dysfunctional uterine bleeding.
State three (3) specific preparations for a patient due for abdominal endoscopy.
Explain three (3) committees of the nursing council of Kenya.
Outline the drug combination used in tuberculosis retreatment.
Explain three (3) nursing interventions for a patient with penetrating chest injury.
State hormones produced by Anterior Pituitary and Adrenal gland.
Describe Artesunate injection properties.
Order the Chain of Infection:
Case Study: Osteoporosis in Elderly. Select Risk Factors, Features, and Management.
Case Study: Laryngeal Cancer & Tracheostomy. Select correct Risks, Indications, Mgmt, Complications.
